Class GuessingGame

java.lang.Object
GuessingGame
public class GuessingGame extends Object
Program runs a game with user where they try to guess a code and the game returns how many correct numbers guessed and how many are in the correct spot
Author:
Brandon N. Wroblewski

  • Constructor Details

    • GuessingGame

      public GuessingGame()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      starts program
      Parameters:
      args - command line argument method creates a random number generate method calls upon the getSecretCode method, the getCorrectDigit method, and the getCorrectDigitsInCorrectPlace method to display information of correct digits, places of users guess, and display if they win (and how many guesses it took), or if they lost (and reveal the secret code).

    • getSecretCode

      public static int[] getSecretCode(Random rand, int length)
      method generates a secret code
      Parameters:
      rand - instance is used to generate digits between 0 and 9
      length - stores given length
      Returns:
      int array of secret code
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - with message "Null rand" if rand equals null
      IllegalArgumentException - with message "Invalid length" if length is less than one

    • getCorrectDigits

      public static int getCorrectDigits(int[] code, int[] guess)
      method tells user how many correct digits they guessed
      Parameters:
      code - stores the secret code
      guess - stores the users guess of the code.
      Returns:
      how many digits are correct
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - with the messge, "Null code" if code is null
      IllegalArgumentException - with the message, "Null guess", if guess is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - with the message, "Different lengths", if the lengths of the code and guess are arrays are different.
      IllegalArgumentException - with the message, "Invalid digit", if the code or guess array contains an integer that is less than 0 or greater than 9.

    • getCorrectDigitsInCorrectPlace

      public static int getCorrectDigitsInCorrectPlace(int[] code, int[] guess)
      method tells user how many of their digits are in correct place
      Parameters:
      code - stores the secret code
      guess - stores the users guess of the code
      Returns:
      number of digits in correct position in array
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - with the messge, "Null code" if code is null
      IllegalArgumentException - with the message, "Null guess", if guess is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - with the message, "Different lengths", if the lengths of the code and guess are arrays are different.
      IllegalArgumentException - with the message, "Invalid digit", if the code or guess array contains an integer that is less than 0 or greater than 9.
